title: Service Workers With Workbox In A Hugo Static Generated Site
description:
As you know, The Polyglot Developer is a static generated website that is built with Hugo. Given the nature of static generated websites, they are generally much faster than the CMS alternatives, but just because they’re fast, doesn’t mean they pass all of Google’s tests by default.

In an ongoing effort to try to satisfy Google PageSpeed Insights and Lighthouse when it comes to search engine optimization (SEO) and other best practices, I was lead to the progressive web application (PWA) test. There are many factors that determine if something is a PWA, but one of those resides in the use of service workers.
